lines.text: Sorry for protruding, Mr. Wiggins, but you're wanted on the phone.
Our plans for our beauty contest are well at hand. So, to decide the Navy's most favorite young woman, each vote to be represented by each 10 cent purchase of merchandise.
Please, Mr. Freytag.
What do you want? What? What is it, eh, Mr. eh, eh, Mr. Squish?
Winch, is the name.
Winch. Alright, go ahead.
Why not make it one vote for every nickel? I sell chewing gum.
Yes. What is it?
Mr. Freytag, your wife's on the phone, she wants to give you a kiss.
You take it and I'll get it from you later.
Hello, angel.
Don't soft soap me. You've got women up there, haven't you August.
Oh, you, you worm! I'll come down there and kick your pants off!
[Slams down the phone]
Oh, that's very sweet of you dear. I'll do the same thing for you some day.
Do you mind if I telephone my wife?
No, she ain't my wife.
Yeah, congratulations.
Mr. Wiggins, I want you to meet Mrs. Freytag, she's a very charming woman. Mrs. Freytag, Mr Wiggins. Mr Wiggins, Mrs. Freytag.
Hiya Toots!
[Phone slams down]
Hey, what's the idea? She hung up right away.
It's a habit I'd wish she'd cultivate.
Woo-woo-woo-woo.
I'll be there in a jiffy. Throw your anchor on the couch and turn on the radio.
Mr. Freytag, I'm sorry. I didn't recognize you.
I'm a victim of a frame up.
You are not! This is all a mistake. I was expecting somebody else.
Your intentions were certainly not honorable.
They were to! I'm a respectable citizen. I was expecting a gentlemen, not him!
Oh, you were, were you. Well, you better tell that to the judge. He's a good listener. Get your duds.
I'll fix you for this, Mr. Fried Egg!
Freytag.
You're still a fried egg to me!
Oh, Gloria.
What kept you so long?
Honest to Pete, I got here as soon as I could.
What'd you do? Race a snail over?
How was the judge to you?
Swell. He treated me like a robbed a gas station.
What'd he book you for?
Conspiracy. What'd you think, manslaughter?
What'd he give you?
30 days in jail or a 100 dollar fine.
Look, you leave everything to me, see.
Yeah, and end up in the chair. No thanks.
I'm going to see the judge. And when I get through with him, you'll either be out or I'll be in.
Don't do it. I know another way to waste your time to better advantage.
How?
Try to raise a 100.
I've got as much chance raising a war debt.
Well, so long, I'll see you in four weeks.
Now, wait. Wait. I've got an idea. You keep your chin up, see.
What for? To lead with?
I'm going to have you on the sidewalk in one hour.
With the fleet in, that sure sounds rosy.
Hey, haven't you girls got any bananas in the house?
How do you like that, he's complaining. Kewpie, you're the kind of a guy that takes a lollipop away from a baby and then kicks because its the wrong flavor.
Don't look now, but, there's something awfully cute sitting over there that's been blinking at me for the last five minutes.
Oh, not bad looking.
That's what makes me nervous. I know my weakness.
Look, Vergie. You might as well go right back to Seattle.
Oh, Mr. Smith, you liked me up north.
Yeah, but you're down south now.
Riding on water always has a funny affect on me.
What affect?
Makes me feel kinda droopy.
Ha-ha-ha. You don't look droopy.
Oh, I don't mean droopy-droopy. I mean dreamy-droopy.
All our lives, let's be dreamy-droopy.
I make 104 dollars and 60 cents a month.
That's plenty.
I'm going to get a pension too.
When?
April 1953. Only 18 years. We have an awful lot to look forward to.
We're going to have an awful lot to look forward to.
After all, Champ, you're going to fight with your mitts, ain't ya?
Well, what do you think I'm going to use? A slingshot? What am I? Samson and Delilah or something?
What's Samson and Delilah got to do with a slingshot?
That just goes to show what you know about bible history. Samson with his slingshot slewed Delilah.
That said, don't try to tell me that I don't know my bible-cal history.
I'm tellin' ya, Samson slew Delilah with a jaw-bone of mule, I'm tellin' ya. Wait a minute, who cut off who's whiskers to make him lose his strength? Answer me, that.
Now, I guess you're going to tell me that Delilah worked in the beauty parlor.
Oh, supposing you got a black eye? How would you look?
Out of the other one.
Annie! Annie!
I heard you the first time.
Is that boyfriend of yours out of jail yet?
You mean Nick or Elmer?
I mean the good-looking one. The one with the scar.
That's Nick. Yeah, he's out on parole again.
Is he working?
Just me.
